marketNews.title: Spot gold price rises 1.6% to $2,977.36 per ounce, reaching all‑time high
marketNews.content: The spot gold price increased by 1.6% to $2,977.36 per troy ounce in Thursday night (13 March) trading, marking an all‑time high. The rise was driven by uncertainty over U.S. tariff policy under President Donald Trump and heightened expectations of monetary easing in the United States as recession concerns grew due to the trade war.

marketNews.title: Forestry minister announces upcoming carbon trading scheme for the forestry sector
marketNews.content: Forestry Minister Raja Juli Antoni said on Thursday (13 March) that carbon trading from the forestry sector will be officially launched soon, with the government working to recognize existing international standards. In the initial phase, the scheme will cover private forest management and social forestry. The minister claimed that the potential carbon trading volume for the forestry sector in 2025 is estimated at 26.5 million tons of CO2, with transaction values ranging from 1.6 to 3.2 trillion rupiah per year.

marketNews.title: Indonesia issues post‑el certification for iPhone 16 series, pending import permit
marketNews.content: The Director of the Ministry of Communication and Digital, Dwi Handoko, stated that the ministry has issued five post‑el certifications for the iPhone 16 series, meaning the Apple product (Nasdaq: AAPL) now only requires an import permit from the Ministry of Trade before it can be sold in Indonesia. The government has begun processing the sales permit for the iPhone 16 after reaching an investment agreement with Apple at the end of February 2025.

marketNews.title: BMKG forecasts a normal dry season in Indonesia for 2025
marketNews.content: Deputy for Climatology at the Meteorology, Climatology, and Geophysics Agency (BMKG), Ardhasena Sopaheluwakan, said on Thursday (13 March) that Indonesia is expected to experience a normal dry season in 2025, following the same pattern as the previous year. The dry season is projected to start in most regions in April and reach its peak between June and August.

tickerNews.title: GoTo targets adjusted EBITDA of Rp1.4‑1.6 trillion for 2025
tickerNews.content: Management of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO) targets adjusted EBITDA of approximately Rp1.4‑1.6 trillion for 2025, with the On‑Demand Services (ODS) segment projected to contribute at least Rp1.1 trillion and the Fintech segment at least Rp350 billion. The target follows GoTo reporting adjusted EBITDA of positive Rp399 billion in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: positive Rp89 billion, 3Q24: positive Rp137 billion). This result brought 2024 adjusted EBITDA to positive Rp386 billion (vs. 2023: negative Rp2.3 trillion), surpassing the company's guidance that aimed for breakeven. At the bottom line, net loss narrowed to Rp1.1 trillion in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: net loss Rp80.4 trillion, 3Q24: net loss Rp655 billion), resulting in a 2024 net loss of Rp3.1 trillion (vs. 2023: net loss Rp87 trillion). ODS segment recorded adjusted EBITDA of positive Rp267 billion in 4Q24 (+12% YoY, +71% QoQ), the highest ever, driven by revenue growth and margin expansion. GoTo expects ODS growth in 2025 to align with the industry, projected to grow low‑mid teens. The company continues to innovate ODS through technology, such as a special delivery fleet that reduces costs and enables competitive pricing, and it boosted advertising revenue (+92% YoY in 4Q24). In the Fintech segment, financing volume rose to Rp5.2 trillion at the end of 2024 (vs. 9M24: Rp4.3 trillion, 2023: Rp1.9 trillion). GoTo aims for financing above Rp8 trillion by the end of 2025. Management said asset quality remains fairly good, though specific metrics were not disclosed. The loan tenor is generally short, averaging three months excluding vehicle financing, allowing rapid adaptation to changing conditions. Regarding share buyback, GoTo disclosed that it repurchased 23.6 billion shares worth about US$91 million or Rp1.5 trillion by the end of February 2025, implying an average purchase price of roughly Rp64 per share. The company has allocated a US$200 million buyback budget. On the rumored merger with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), management said it could not comment and chose to stay focused on executing its strategy, given the still large market potential. Finally, the company said it will provide holiday allowance (THR) to productive, high‑performing partners and will manage the additional cost within its planned budget.

tickerNews.title: Summarecon Agung posts net profit of Rp440 billion in 4Q24, 79% YoY increase for 2024
tickerNews.content: $SMRA: Summarecon Agung reported net profit of Rp440 billion in 4Q24 (+289% YoY, +144% QoQ). This result brought 2024 net profit to approximately Rp1.4 trillion (+79% YoY), exceeding expectations at 116% of consensus estimates. Although gross profit margin fell to 47.8% in 4Q24 (‑260 basis points YoY, ‑640 bps QoQ), higher revenue growth relative to operating expenses expanded operating profit margin to 30.8% (+800 bps YoY, +130 bps QoQ). Strong revenue growth in 4Q24 was mainly driven by revenue recognition in the residential segment (+220% YoY, +125% QoQ). The company also disclosed that its previously planned IPO subsidiary, PT Summarecon Investment Property, has changed status from a public company to a closed company because the initial public offering has not been carried out.

tickerNews.title: Bank Central Asia announces final dividend cum‑date on 20 March 2025
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: Bank Central Asia announced that the cum‑date for the final dividend in the regular market and negotiations will fall on 20 March 2025, with payment on 11 April 2025. Previously, BBCA shareholders approved a final dividend for fiscal year 2024 of Rp250 per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 2.9% as of Friday (14 March). BBCA also distributed an interim dividend of Rp50 per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Battery Materials delivers first 6,500 tons of nickel MHP in March 2025
tickerNews.content: $MBMA: The President Director of Merdeka Battery Materials, Teddy Oetomo, said the company completed its first shipment of 6,500 tons of nickel mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) in March 2025. The shipment originated from the HPAL smelter owned by PT ESG New Energy Material, a joint venture between Merdeka Battery Materials and GEM Co. Ltd. The PT ESG New Energy Material smelter has an annual production capacity of 30,000 tons of nickel MHP.

tickerNews.title: Bank Tabungan Negara plans global bond issuance up to US$400 million
tickerNews.content: $BBTN: The President Director of Bank Tabungan Negara, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, said the bank has held meetings with foreign investors regarding a global bond issuance of up to US$400 million (approximately Rp6.5 trillion). The proceeds will be used to support mortgage lending for low‑income households. Previously, Nixon indicated that BBTN planned to issue bonds worth around Rp10‑15 trillion during 2025 to meet liquidity needs for mortgage lending.

tickerNews.title: Bukit Asam targets completion of Tanjung Enim‑Kramasan coal transport expansion by 3Q26
tickerNews.content: $PTBA: The President Director of Bukit Asam, Arsal Ismail, said the company targets the development of the Tanjung Enim‑Kramasan coal transport project to be completed in 3Q26. The expansion is expected to add 20 million tons per year to the company's production capacity.

tickerNews.title: Sariguna Primatirta to sell all buyback shares to PT Tancorp Global Abadi
tickerNews.content: $CLEO: Sariguna Primatirta announced that it will sell all its buyback shares, approximately 40 million shares, to its controlling shareholder PT Tancorp Global Abadi in a phased manner starting 21 March 2025. The company did not disclose the sale price of the shares.

tickerNews.title: Indocement reports modest cement sales volume growth of 0.5% YoY in February 2025
tickerNews.content: $INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a 0.5% year‑over‑year increase in cement sales volume in February 2025, with market share falling to 28.6% (January 2025: 31%, February 2024: 29.9%) as total industry sales rose 5% YoY. Annual growth remained flat due to rain and floods in Java, which accounted for 65% of the company's total sales volume. February 2025 sales were supported by Central Java (+2.7% YoY) while West Java declined (-2.7% YoY). By product segment, bagged cement volume grew 3.3% YoY, whereas bulk cement fell 5.9% YoY, mainly due to normalization of demand in the new capital region (IKN). Over the first two months of 2025, INTP's sales volume decreased 0.1% YoY, outperforming the industry which fell 0.4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: Avia invests Rp276 billion for 16.67% stake in PT Dextone Lemindo
tickerNews.content: $AVIA: Avia Avian made a capital injection of Rp276 billion for a 16.67% ownership in PT Dextone Lemindo through the issuance of new shares. The transaction is intended to develop the company's business activities and product portfolio in the adhesive/ glue industry.

tickerNews.title: Dana Brata Luhur shareholder PT Dua Samudera Perkasa buys ~114 million TEBE shares
tickerNews.content: $TEBE: Shareholder of Dana Brata Luhur, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa, purchased approximately 114 million TEBE shares at Rp500 per share on 12 March 2025. The transaction value was about Rp57 billion. After the transaction, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa's ownership in TEBE increased from 15.63% to 24.52%.

tickerNews.title: Hillcon controlling shareholder sells ~7.5 million HILL shares
tickerNews.content: $HILL: Controlling shareholder of Hillcon, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold approximately 7.5 million HILL shares at Rp2,100 per share on 12 March 2025. The transaction value was about Rp15.8 billion. After the sale, PT Hillcon Equity Management's ownership in HILL decreased from 59.57% to 59.32%.
